description: Numbers n such that final 2 nonzero digits of n! are '68'.
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences related to final digits of numbers
prog: (PARI) last(n,k)=if(n*8\9-1<k, n=n!; return(n/10^valuation(n,10)%10^k)); my(m=Mod(1,5^k)); for(i=2,n,m*=i/10^valuation(i,5));lift(chinese(m, Mod(0,2^k))) \\ Gives the last k decimal digits of n!.is(n)=last(n,2)==68 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 22 2014(PARI) is(n)=my(m=Mod(1,25)); for(i=2,n, m*=i/10^valuation(i,5)); m==68 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 22 2014(PARI) v=List();m=Mod(1,25);for(n=2,1e6,m*=n/10^valuation(n,5);if(m==68,listput(v,n);if(#v==100, return(Vec(v))))) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 22 2014
author: _Jeff Burch_
